An intern generated their RSA keys using two secret but "special" primes. A message was sent: 5137996934323781236828044617487028730099177454228996964220505089693188037433326179342592733957483540583969323517351865963667485221296178445371309176221086. Find the flaw and recover the plaintext.

The flag format is flag{...}
n=8855977633907707098951092048966490656217882017893050218050899431887022146719759031227875631764650620210625372392621796220499909323585297276610237710469461, e=3323811672277533892152149758723854192849296894876502191802885702924982359451064507410438986871999879568736598634384013459044411084869945570396284670508911
The lower 104 bits of p are: 49488222088968589002118111914312760147


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{mx3akl8l}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 5137996934323781236828044617487028730099177454228996964220505089693188037433326179342592733957483540583969323517351865963667485221296178445371309176221086
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=8855977633907707098951092048966490656217882017893050218050899431887022146719759031227875631764650620210625372392621796220499909323585297276610237710469461, e=3323811672277533892152149758723854192849296894876502191802885702924982359451064507410438986871999879568736598634384013459044411084869945570396284670508911
The lower 104 bits of p are: 49488222088968589002118111914312760147

extra_info: p=96677973508173567993046495812022013315527822037121866822457881929767354268499, q=91602847189996023231568992443972014438751248771602604886954056516293143002039, Ï†(n)=8855977633907707098951092048966490656217882017893050218050899431887022146719570750407177462173426004722369378364867517149691184851875885338164177213198924
